input.description: Input text to embed, encoded as a string or array of tokens. Cannot be empty.

Creates a model response for the given conversation. The following parameters are not working for the `TensorRT-LLM` engine:
- `frequency_penalty`
- `presence_penalty`
- `top_p`
Pull a model from a remote source.

metadata.lastMessage:
Based on the context, I'm not sure how to build a unique experience quickly and easily. The text mentions that there are some concerns about Android apps providing consistent experiences for different users, which makes me skeptical about building one.

Specifically, it says:

* "Might not pass CTS" (Computer Science Technology standards)
* "Might not comply with CDD" (Consumer Development Division standards)

This suggests that building a unique experience for all users could be challenging or impossible. Therefore, I don't know how to build a unique experience quickly and easily.

Would you like me to try again?
metadata.title: hello

info.title: Cortex API
info.description: Cortex API enables API commands for seamless interaction with LLMs.

tags.name: Chat
tags.description: This endpoint initiates interaction with a Large Language Models (LLM).

tags.name: Embeddings
tags.description: This endpoint create embeddings for a given input text or tokens.

tags.name: Assistants
tags.description: These endpoints manage the lifecycle of an Assistant within a conversation thread.

tags.name: Pulling Models
tags.description: These endpoints handle downloading and importing models.

tags.name: Running Models
tags.description: These endpoints support a range of operations that allow users to effectively control and interact with their models

tags.name: Server
tags.description: These endpoints manage the lifecycle of Server, including heath check and shutdown.

tags.name: Configurations
tags.description: These endpoints manage the configuration of the Cortex server.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: These endpoints manage the retrieval and storage of conversation content, including responses from LLMs and other metadata related to chat interactions.

tags.name: Threads
tags.description: These endpoints handle the creation, retrieval, updating, and deletion of conversation threads.

tags.name: Engines
tags.description: Endpoints for managing the available engines within Cortex.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: Endpoints for managing the files within Cortex.

tags.name: Hardware
tags.description: Endpoints for managing the available hardware within Cortex.

tags.name: System
tags.description: Endpoints for stopping the Cortex API server, checking its status, and fetching system events.

id.description: The unique identifier of the assistant.

description.example: A default assistant that can use all downloaded models
description.default: A default assistant that can use all downloaded models

model.description: The model of the assistant.

tools.description: The tools associated with the assistant.

id.description: The identifier of the assistant that was deleted.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a assistant.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the assistant was successfully deleted.

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

role.description: The role of the messages author, in this case `system`.

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

role.description: The role of the messages author, in this case `user`.

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

role.description: The role of the messages author, in this case `assistant`.

content.description: The contents of the assistant message. Required unless `tool_calls` or `function_call` is specified.

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

role.description: The role of the messages author, in this case `tool`.

type.description: The type of the content part. Always `input_audio`.

url.description: Either a URL of the image or the base64 encoded image data.

detail.description: Specifies the detail level of the image. Defaults to `auto`.

format.description: The format of the encoded audio data. Currently supports `wav` and `mp3`.

Audio.description: Data about a previous audio response from the model.

id.description: Unique identifier for a previous audio response from the model.

messages.description: Array of chat messages to be used for generating the chat completion. Depending on the model you use, different message types (modalities) are supported, like text, images, and audio. Currently, cortex only support text modalities.

model.description: The unique identifier of the model.

stream.description: Determines the format for output generation. If set to `true`, the output is generated continuously, allowing for real-time streaming of responses. If set to `false`, the output is delivered in a single JSON file.

max_tokens.description: Sets the upper limit on the number of tokens the model can generate in a single output. This value is now deprecated in favor of `max_completion_tokens`.

max_completion_tokens.description: Sets the upper limit on the number of tokens the model can generate in a single output.

stop.description: Defines specific tokens or phrases that signal the model to stop producing further output.

frequency_penalty.description: Modifies the likelihood of the model repeating the same words or phrases within a single output.

presence_penalty.description: Reduces the likelihood of repeating tokens, promoting novelty in the output.

temperature.description: Influences the randomness of the model's output.

top_p.description: Sets probability threshold for more relevant outputs.

modalities.description: Specifies the modalities (types of input) supported by the model. Currently, cortex only support text modalities. We are actively working on this feature to bring cortex as fully OpenAI compatible platform. Planning and roadmap for this feature can be found [**here**](https://github.com/janhq/cortex.cpp/issues/1582).

audio.description: Parameters for audio output. Required when audio output is requested with `modalities: ['audio']`. We are actively working on this feature to bring cortex as fully OpenAI compatible platform. Planning and roadmap for this feature can be found [**here**](https://github.com/janhq/cortex.cpp/issues/1582).

voice.description: The voice of the generated audio.

format.description: Specifies the output audio format. Must be one of `wav`, `mp3`, `flac`, `opus`, or `pcm16`.

store.description: Whether or not to store the output of this chat completion request for use in our model distillation or evals products. We are actively working on this feature to bring cortex as fully OpenAI compatible platform. Planning and roadmap for this feature can be found [**here**](https://github.com/janhq/cortex.cpp/issues/1582).

metadata.description: Developer-defined tags and values used for filtering completions in the dashboard. We are actively working on this feature to bring cortex as fully OpenAI compatible platform. Planning and roadmap for this feature can be found [**here**](https://github.com/janhq/cortex.cpp/issues/1582).

logit_bias.description:
Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion. 

Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If true, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. `logprobs` must be set to `true` if this parameter is used.

n.description: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message. Note that you will be charged based on the number of generated tokens across all of the choices. Keep n as 1 to minimize costs.

response_format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output. Setting to { "type": "json_object" } enables JSON mode, which guarantees the message the model generates is valid JSON. We are actively working on this feature to bring cortex as fully OpenAI compatible platform. Planning and roadmap for this feature can be found [**here**](https://github.com/janhq/cortex.cpp/issues/1582).

type.description: The format of the generated output. Must be one of `text`, `json_schema` or `json_object`.

seed.description: This feature is in Beta. If specified, our system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same seed and parameters should return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed, and you should refer to the system_fingerprint response parameter to monitor changes in the backend.

service_tier.description:
Specifies the latency tier to use for processing the request. This parameter is relevant for customers subscribed to the scale tier service:

 - If set to 'auto', and the Project is Scale tier enabled, the system will utilize scale tier credits until they are exhausted.
- If set to 'auto', and the Project is not Scale tier enabled, the request will be processed using the default service tier with a lower uptime SLA and no latency guarentee.
- If set to 'default', the request will be processed using the default service tier with a lower uptime SLA and no latency guarentee.
When not set, the default behavior is 'auto'.
When this parameter is set, the response body will include the service_tier utilized.

 We are actively working on this feature to bring cortex as fully OpenAI compatible platform. Planning and roadmap for this feature can be found [**here**](https://github.com/janhq/cortex.cpp/issues/1582).

stream_options.description: Options for streaming response. Only set this when you set `stream: true`.

include_usage.description: If set, an additional chunk will be streamed before the data: `[DONE]` message. The `usage` field on this chunk shows the token usage statistics for the entire request, and the `choices` field will always be an empty array. All other chunks will also include a `usage` field, but with a null value.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to enable parallel function calling during tool use. Cortex support parallel tool calls by default

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse. We are actively working on this feature to bring cortex as fully OpenAI compatible platform. Planning and roadmap for this feature can be found [**here**](https://github.com/janhq/cortex.cpp/issues/1582).

dynatemp_range.description: Dynamic temperature range. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

dynatemp_exponent.description: Dynamic temperature exponent. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

top_k.description: The number of most likely tokens to consider at each step. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

min_p.description: Minimum probability threshold for token sampling. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

tfs_z.description: The z-score used for Typical token sampling. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

typ_p.description: The cumulative probability threshold used for Typical token sampling. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

repeat_last_n.description: Number of previous tokens to penalize for repeating. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

repeat_penalty.description: Penalty for repeating tokens. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

mirostat.description: Enables or disables Mirostat sampling (true or false). This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

mirostat_tau.description: Target entropy value for Mirostat sampling. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

mirostat_eta.description: Learning rate for Mirostat sampling. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

penalize_nl.description: Penalizes newline tokens (true or false). This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

ignore_eos.description: Ignores the end-of-sequence token (true or false). This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

n_probs.description: Number of probabilities to return. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

min_keep.description: Minimum number of tokens to keep. This parameter only supported by `llama-cpp` engine.

content.description: The textual content of the chat message or completion generated by the model.

role.description: The role of the participant in the chat, such as 'user' or 'system', indicating who is the sender of the message.

finish_reason.description: The reason the chat completion ended, typically indicating whether the model completed the text naturally or was cut off.

index.description: The index of the completion relative to other generated completions, useful for identifying its order in a batch request.

message.description: An object representing the message details involved in the chat completion, encapsulated within a MessageDto.

completion_tokens.description: The number of tokens used in the completion part of the response generated by the model.

prompt_tokens.description: The number of tokens used in the prompt part of the chat input, which is provided to the model.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used in both the prompt and the completion, summarizing the entire token count of the chat operation.

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion.

choices.description: A list of chat completion choices. Can be more than one if n is greater than 1.

finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be stop if the model hit a natural stop point or a provided stop sequence, length if the maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached, content_filter if content was omitted due to a flag from our content filters, tool_calls if the model called a tool, or function_call (deprecated) if the model called a function.

index.description: The index of the choice in the list of choices.

refusal.description: The refusal message generated by the model.

tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

id.description: The ID of the tool call.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only function is supported.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

arguments.description: The arguments to call the function with, as generated by the model in JSON format. Note that the model does not always generate valid JSON, and may hallucinate parameters not defined by your function schema. Validate the arguments in your code before calling your function.

role.description: The role of the author of this message.

function_call.description: Deprecated and replaced by tool_calls. The name and arguments of a function that should be called, as generated by the model.

arguments.description: The arguments to call the function with, as generated by the model in JSON format. Note that the model does not always generate valid JSON, and may hallucinate parameters not defined by your function schema. Validate the arguments in your code before calling your function.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

audio.description: If the audio output modality is requested, this object contains data about the audio response from the model.

id.description: Unique identifier for this audio response.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when this audio response will no longer be accessible on the server for use in multi-turn conversations.

data.description: Base64 encoded audio bytes generated by the model, in the format specified in the request.

transcript.description: Transcript of the audio generated by the model.

logprobs.description: Log probability information for the choice.

content.description: A list of message content tokens with log probability information.

logprob.description: The log probability of this token, if it is within the top 20 most likely tokens. Otherwise, the value -9999.0 is used to signify that the token is very unlikely.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be null if there is no bytes representation for the token.

top_logprobs.description: List of the most likely tokens and their log probability, at this token position. In rare cases, there may be fewer than the number of requested top_logprobs returned.

logprob.description: The log probability of this token, if it is within the top 20 most likely tokens. Otherwise, the value -9999.0 is used to signify that the token is very unlikely.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be null if there is no bytes representation for the token.

refusal.description: A list of message refusal tokens with log probability information.

logprob.description: The log probability of this token, if it is within the top 20 most likely tokens. Otherwise, the value -9999.0 is used to signify that the token is very unlikely.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be null if there is no bytes representation for the token.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created.

model.description: The model used for the chat completion.

service_tier.description: The service tier used for processing the request. This field is only included if the service_tier parameter is specified in the request.

system_fingerprint.description: This fingerprint represents the backend configuration that the model runs with. Can be used in conjunction with the seed request parameter to understand when backend changes have been made that might impact determinism.

object.description: The object type, which is always chat.completion.

usage.description: Usage statistics for the completion request.

completion_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the generated completion.

prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used in the request (prompt + completion).

completion_tokens_details.description: Breakdown of tokens used in a completion.

audio_tokens.description: Audio input tokens generated by the model.

reasoning_tokens.description: Tokens generated by the model for reasoning.

prompt_tokens_details.description: Breakdown of tokens used in the prompt.

audio_tokens.description: Audio input tokens present in the prompt.

cached_tokens.description: Cached tokens present in the prompt.

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion. Each chunk has the same ID.

choices.description: A list of chat completion choices. Can contain more than one element if n is greater than 1. Can also be empty for the last chunk if you set stream_options: {"include_usage": true}.

delta.description: A chat completion delta generated by streamed model responses.

content.description: The contents of the chunk message.

function_call.description: Deprecated and replaced by tool_calls. The name and arguments of a function that should be called, as generated by the model.

tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model.

index.description: The index of the tool call in the list of tool calls.

id.description: The ID of the tool call.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only function is supported.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

arguments.description: The arguments to call the function with, as generated by the model in JSON format. Note that the model does not always generate valid JSON, and may hallucinate parameters not defined by your function schema. Validate the arguments in your code before calling your function.

role.description: The role of the author of this message.

refusal.description: The refusal message generated by the model.

logprobs.description: Log probability information for the choice.

content.description: A list of message content tokens with log probability information.

logprob.description: The log probability of this token, if it is within the top 20 most likely tokens. Otherwise, the value -9999.0 is used to signify that the token is very unlikely.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be null if there is no bytes representation for the token.

top_logprobs.description: List of the most likely tokens and their log probability, at this token position. In rare cases, there may be fewer than the number of requested top_logprobs returned.

logprob.description: The log probability of this token, if it is within the top 20 most likely tokens. Otherwise, the value -9999.0 is used to signify that the token is very unlikely.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be null if there is no bytes representation for the token.

refusal.description: A list of message refusal tokens with log probability information.

logprob.description: The log probability of this token, if it is within the top 20 most likely tokens. Otherwise, the value -9999.0 is used to signify that the token is very unlikely.

bytes.description: A list of integers representing the UTF-8 bytes representation of the token. Useful in instances where characters are represented by multiple tokens and their byte representations must be combined to generate the correct text representation. Can be null if there is no bytes representation for the token.

finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens. This will be stop if the model hit a natural stop point or a provided stop sequence, length if the maximum number of tokens specified in the request was reached, content_filter if content was omitted due to a flag from our content filters, tool_calls if the model called a tool, or function_call (deprecated) if the model called a function.

index.description: The index of the choice in the list of choices.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created. Each chunk has the same timestamp.

model.description: The model used to generate the completion.

service_tier.description: The service tier used for processing the request. This field is only included if the service_tier parameter is specified in the request.

system_fingerprint.description: This fingerprint represents the backend configuration that the model runs with. Can be used in conjunction with the seed request parameter to understand when backend changes have been made that might impact determinism.

object.description: The object type, which is always chat.completion.chunk.

usage.description: An optional field that will only be present when you set stream_options: {"include_usage": true} in your request. When present, it contains a null value except for the last chunk which contains the token usage statistics for the entire request.

completion_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the generated completion.

prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used in the request (prompt + completion).

model.description: The name of the embedding model to be used.

input.description: The text or token array(s) to be embedded. This can be a single string, an array of strings, or an array of token arrays to embed multiple inputs in one request.

encoding_format.description: Specifies the format for the embeddings. Supported formats include `float` and `int`. This field is optional.

dimensions.description: Defines the number of dimensions for the output embeddings. This feature is supported by certain models only. This field is optional.

object.description: Type of the result object.

model.description: Identifier of the model utilized for generating embeddings.

embedding.description: The embedding vector represented as an array of floating-point numbers.

usage.description: Details of token usage, including prompt_tokens and total_tokens.

model.description: The identifier or URL of the model to use. It can be a model ID on Cortexso (https://huggingface.co/cortexso) or a HuggingFace URL pointing to the model file. For example: 'gpt2' or 'https://huggingface.co/TheBloke/Mistral-7B-Instruct-v0.1-GGUF/blob/main/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.1.Q2_K.gguf'

id.description: The id which will be used to register the model.

name.description: The name which will be used to overwrite the model name.

model.description: The identifier of the model.

engine.description: The engine used for the model.

model.description: The unique identifier of the model.

files.description: The URL sources from which the model downloaded or accessed.

prompt_template.description: A predefined text or framework that guides the AI model's response generation.
prompt_template.example: You are an expert in {subject}. Provide a detailed and thorough explanation on the topic of {topic}.

stop.description: Defines specific tokens or phrases that signal the model to stop producing further output.

max_tokens.description: Sets the upper limit on the number of tokens the model can generate in a single output.

top_p.description: Sets probability threshold for more relevant outputs.

temperature.description: Influences the randomness of the model's output.

frequency_penalty.description: Modifies the likelihood of the model repeating the same words or phrases within a single output.

presence_penalty.description: Reduces the likelihood of repeating tokens, promoting novelty in the output.

stream.description: Determines the format for output generation. If set to `true`, the output is generated continuously, allowing for real-time streaming of responses. If set to `false`, the output is delivered in a single JSON file.

ctx_len.description: Sets the maximum input the model can use to generate a response, it varies with the model used.

n_parallel.description: Number of parallel processing units to use.

cpu_threads.description: Determines CPU inference threads, limited by hardware and OS.

engine.description: The engine used to run the model.

message.description: The success or error message displayed when a model is successfully loaded or fails to load.

modelId.description: The unique identifier of the model.

model.description: A downloaded model name.

ctx_len.description: The context length for model operations varies; the maximum depends on the specific model used.

n_parallel.description: Number of parallel processing units to use.

cache_type.description: KV cache type: f16, q8_0, q4_0, default is f16

caching_enabled.description: To enable prompt caching or not

model_path.description: Local path to LLM model file

mmproj.description: Local path to mmproj model file

model.description: A downloaded model name.
The unique identifier of the model.

modelPath.description: The file path to the model.

name.description: The display name of the model.

option.description: Import options such as symlink or copy.

modelHandle.description: The unique identifier of the imported model.

message.description: The response success or error message.

description.example: This extension enables chat completion API calls using the Onnx engine

id.description: The model identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

prompt_template.example: You are an expert in {subject}. Provide a detailed and thorough explanation on the topic of {topic}.
prompt_template.description: A predefined text or framework that guides the AI model's response generation.

stop.description: Defines specific tokens or phrases that signal the model to stop producing further output.

max_tokens.description: Sets the upper limit on the number of tokens the model can generate in a single output.

temperature.description: Influences the randomness of the model's output.

top_p.description: Sets probability threshold for more relevant outputs

stream.description: Determines the format for output generation. If set to `true`, the output is generated continuously, allowing for real-time streaming of responses. If set to `false`, the output is delivered in a single JSON file.

frequency_penalty.description: Modifies the likelihood of the model repeating the same words or phrases within a single output.

presence_penalty.description: Reduces the likelihood of repeating tokens, promoting novelty in the output.

ctx_len.description: The context length for model operations varies; the maximum depends on the specific model used.

cpu_threads.description: Determines CPU inference threads, limited by hardware and OS.

pre_prompt.description: The prompt to use for internal configuration
pre_prompt.example: You are an assistant with expert knowledge in {subject}. Please provide a detailed and accurate response to the following query: {query}. Ensure that your response is clear, concise, and informative.

n_batch.description: The batch size for prompt eval step

caching_enabled.description: To enable prompt caching or not

mlock.description: Prevent system swapping of the model to disk in macOS

grammar_file.description: You can constrain the sampling using GBNF grammars by providing path to a grammar file

flash_attn.description: To enable Flash Attention, default is true

cache_type.description: KV cache type: f16, q8_0, q4_0, default is f16

use_mmap.description: To enable mmap, default is true

size.description: The model file size in bytes

files.description: List of file paths associated with the model. Can be relative or absolute.

stop.description: Tokens that signal the end of generation.

stream.description: Whether to stream the output as it is generated.

top_p.description: Controls nucleus sampling; the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass.

temperature.description: Controls randomness in token selection; lower values make the output more deterministic.

frequency_penalty.description: Penalizes repeated tokens based on their frequency.

presence_penalty.description: Penalizes tokens that have already appeared in the output.

max_tokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate.

seed.description: Seed for random number generation to ensure reproducibility; -1 for random seed.

top_k.description: Limits the sampling pool to the top_k most probable tokens.

min_p.description: Minimum probability threshold for token selection.

typ_p.description: Controls typical sampling; similar to top_p but focuses on local token distribution.

repeat_last_n.description: Number of recent tokens to consider for repetition penalty.

ignore_eos.description: Whether to ignore end-of-sequence tokens during generation.

n_probs.description: Number of probabilities to consider for each token.

min_keep.description: Minimum number of tokens to keep in the buffer.

engine.description: The engine used to run the model.

n_parallel.description: Number of parallel threads for execution.

id.description: The identifier of the model that was deleted.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a model.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the model was successfully deleted.

id.description: The unique identifier of the assistant.

avatar.description: URL of the assistant's avatar image.

model.description: The model's unique identifier and settings.

instructions.example: Assist with customer queries and provide information based on the company database.

description.example: This assistant helps with customer support by retrieving relevant information.

object.description: The object type, always "assistant".

top_p.description: Top-p sampling value for the assistant.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the assistant was created.

response_format.description: The response format option for the assistant.

assistants.description: The details of the thread's settings.

example.value: How does AI work? Explain it in simple terms.

text.description: Text content of the message along with any annotations.

id.description: The identifier of the message.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread message.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the message.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread to which this message belongs.

role.description: Role of the sender, either 'user' or 'assistant'.

content.description: Array of content objects detailing the message content.

file_ids.description: Array of file IDs associated with the message, if any.

assistant_id.description: Identifier of the assistant involved in the message, if applicable.

run_id.description: Run ID associated with the message, if applicable.

id.description: The identifier of the message.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread message.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the message.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread to which this message belongs.

role.description: Role of the sender, either 'user' or 'assistant'.

file_ids.description: Array of file IDs associated with the message, if any.

assistant_id.description: Identifier of the assistant involved in the message, if applicable.

run_id.description: Run ID associated with the message, if applicable.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a list.

first_id.description: Identifier of the first message in the list.

last_id.description: Identifier of the last message in the list.

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more messages to retrieve.

role.description:
The role of the entity that is creating the message. Allowed values include:
      - user: Indicates the message is sent by an actual user and should be used in most cases to represent user-generated messages.
      - assistant: Indicates the message is generated by the assistant. Use this value to insert messages from the assistant into the conversation.

content.description: The text contents of the message.

id.description: The identifier of the message that was deleted.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a message.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the message was successfully deleted.

id.description: The identifier of the thread.

object.description: Type of the object

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the thread.

assistants.description: List of assistants involved in the thread.

messages.description: List of messages within the thread.

id.description: The identifier of the thread that was deleted.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the thread was successfully deleted.

cores.description: The number of CPU cores available.

instructions.description: A list of supported CPU instruction sets.

model.description: The model name of the CPU.

activated.description: Indicates if the GPU is currently activated.

compute_cap.description: The compute capability of the GPU.

driver_version.description: The version of the installed driver.

free_vram.description: The amount of free VRAM in MB.

id.description: Unique identifier for the GPU.

name.description: The name of the GPU model.

total_vram.description: The total VRAM available in MB.

uuid.description: The universally unique identifier for the GPU.

name.description: The name of the operating system.

version.description: The version of the operating system.

battery_life.description: The percentage of battery life remaining.

charging_status.description: The charging status of the device.

is_power_saving.description: Indicates if the power-saving mode is enabled.

available.description: The amount of available RAM in MB.
The amount of available storage in MB.
